p:
Pino et al.
27 reported 112 bones, representing a minimum of eight extinct megafaunal taxa (Figs 15 and 16a), including the gomphothere (cf. Notiomastodon platensis), American horse ( Equus ( Amerhippus) andium), one sloth ( Xenarthra indet.), and one camelid (cf. Hemiauchenia paradoxa)
27, 29, 31, 33, 121 . Most of these megafaunal bones were found in unit PB-7, while the overlying unit PB-8, immediately below the YDB layer, contains only extinct horse remains. For example, a coprolite from an extinct horse was found in unit PB-8 a few cm below the YDB layer and has a calibrated age range of 13,065–12,749 cal BP (mean age of 12,907 ± 158 cal BP; 11,004 ± 186 14C years BP)
27 .
